vital_signs.oxygen_saturation: 93% (with supplemental oxygen at times as low as 70 mmHg)

relevant_findings.general: Patient appeared comfortable but had mild respiratory distress that increased with exertion.
relevant_findings.lung: Conjunctivae injected, crackles over the lower third of both lungs, mild bilateral wheezes.
relevant_findings.heart: Grade 2 systolic murmur at the upper right sternal border.
relevant_findings.abdomen: Distended and tympanitic without organomegaly or tenderness.
relevant_findings.other: Large prostatic nodule on rectal examination, positive for occult blood in stool.

physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Temperature was initially 38.9°C and 37.7°C during the hospital visit, with subsequent drops to 36.7°C and then afebrile status.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Electrocardiogram showed atrial fibrillation at a ventricular rate of 100 bpm without ischemic changes.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: No chest pain noted during this period despite elevated creatine kinase level; efibrile status established after this.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Chest radiograph revealed patchy interstitial and air-space opacities with small pleural effusions.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Improvements noted with subsequent imaging, showing a slightly improved atelectasis and similar pleural effusions.
